intro: Xylopia platycarpa, commonly known as the broad-fruited xylopia, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Annonaceae and is characterized by its aromatic, rough bark and simple, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by woody, spherical fruits containing several seeds. Xylopia platycarpa is valued for its medicinal properties, with various parts of the plant used in traditional medicine. Its ecological importance includes providing habitat and food for a variety of wildlife.
